title: 111_hr2680
content: The Act titled "Territorial Health Parity Act of 2009" aims to provide Medicaid payment parity for the territories. The "Territorial Health Parity Act of 2009" eliminates funding limitations for Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa under the Social Security Act. The "Territorial Health Parity Act of 2009" removes funding restrictions for Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa under the Social Security Act, starting from fiscal year 2010. Additionally, there will be parity in the Federal medical assistance percentage for these territories beginning in fiscal year 2012. The "Territorial Health Parity Act of 2009" removes funding restrictions for Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa under the Social Security Act for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. The Federal medical assistance percentage for these territories will be the highest applicable to any of the 50 States or the District of Columbia during this period. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will submit a report to Congress by October 1, 2010, detailing the per capita income data used to calculate Federal medical assistance percentages for territories. Recommendations will be included on how to ensure parity with the 50 States and the District of Columbia. The Social Security Act is amended to include Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa in the per capita income data used for Federal medical assistance percentages. Data from the Department of the Interior can be used if satisfactory data is not available for the territories. The Social Security Act is amended to include Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa in the per capita income data used for Federal medical assistance percentages. Data from the Department of the Interior can be used if satisfactory data is not available for the territories. The provisions of section 5001(b)(2) of division B of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 shall not apply in territories where this subsection is in effect. SEC. 3. CLARIFICATION OF MEDICAID COVERAGE FOR CITIZENS OF FREELY ASSOCIATED STATES. Amendment to the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 allows citizens of freely associated states residing in the US to be exempt from Medicaid eligibility requirements. Amendment to the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 exempts citizens of freely associated states residing in the US from Medicaid eligibility requirements. This includes individuals lawfully residing in the US under a Compact of Free Association, with Medicaid program coverage set at 100 percent FMAP. The amendments made by this Act, effective on October 1, 2009, provide medical assistance for individuals described in section 402(b)(2)(G) of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996.
